meanings.definition: To live together in a sexual relationship without being married.
meanings.sent1: Many couples choose to cohabit before getting married.
meanings.sent2: They decided to cohabit and see if they were compatible before tying the knot.
meanings.sent3: The two lovebirds were happy to cohabit and share their lives together.
meanings.sent4: Their decision to cohabit was a bold step towards a committed relationship.
meanings.sent5: Living together without marriage, also known as cohabiting, has become more common in modern society.

meanings.definition: To exist together in harmony or at the same time.
meanings.sent1: In nature, different species often cohabit in the same ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The various colors in the painting cohabit beautifully, creating a stunning masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The flavors of sweet and salty cohabit in this delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The old and new architecture cohabit in the city, blending history with modernity.
meanings.sent5: Music and dance cohabit in perfect synchronization during the performance.
